title: Quiz 5: Epilepsy, Sickle Cell & Respiratory
description: Assess your understanding of Epilepsy, Sickle Cell Anemia, and Chronic Respiratory Diseases.

questions.question: What is the primary cause of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)?
questions.explanation: COPD is mainly caused by smoking, leading to emphysema and chronic bronchitis.

questions.question: True or False: You should restrain a person having an epileptic seizure to prevent them from hurting themselves.
questions.explanation: This is a myth. Restraining a person during a seizure is dangerous. You should protect their head but not restrain them.
questions.hint: Safety first, but do not restrict movement forcibly.

questions.question: Sickle cell anemia is an inherited ___BLANK___ disorder where abnormal hemoglobin causes red blood cells to become ___BLANK___ shaped.
questions.explanation: Sickle cell anemia is a blood disorder where cells take a sickle shape.
questions.hint: The name of the disease describes the shape.

questions.question: Which of the following are symptoms of Epilepsy? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Symptoms include loss of consciousness, convulsions, sensory disturbances, and aura. Weight gain is not a direct symptom.

questions.question: Match the respiratory condition to its description:

richContent.content:
ConditionKey Feature
COPDAirflow limitation
AsthmaAirway inflammation

pairs.right: Leads to emphysema and chronic bronchitis

questions.explanation: COPD involves permanent damage (emphysema); Asthma involves inflammation/wheezing.
questions.hint: COPD is often related to smoking history; Asthma often involves triggers/allergies.

questions.question: Sickle cell anemia is prevalent in which region mentioned in the text?
questions.explanation: It is prevalent in Sub-Saharan Africa, South Asia, Middle East, and the Mediterranean.
questions.hint: The region south of the Sahara desert.

questions.question: Order the genetics of Sickle Cell inheritance:

items.text: Child inherits two defective genes (one from each)

questions.explanation: Inheritance of genes -> Abnormal hemoglobin -> Sickling of cells.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a myth about epilepsy?
questions.explanation: Epilepsy IS a neurological disorder. The others are listed as myths/misconceptions.
questions.hint: Identify the scientific fact among the false beliefs.

questions.question: What are common triggers/risk factors for Asthma? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Asthma triggers include allergies, irritants, and genetics. Sugar is not a direct trigger.
questions.hint: Think about things you breathe in or genetic traits.

questions.question: What is the potential cure mentioned for Sickle Cell Anemia?
questions.explanation: Bone marrow transplant is listed as a potential cure. Others are management strategies.
questions.hint: It involves replacing the source of blood cells.
